page.title: 04Farming around Hampton
page.content: Most of the land in our block is used for{farming.}The land is quite fertile, lying in the valley of the River Blythe. The type of farmland is fairly evenly divided between {intensively managed grassland}for hay, silage and grazing, and other crops. These are mainly{wheat}and{barley,}but also quite a lot of{oil-seed rape}and a variety of minor crops such as kale. A typical farm is{Station Farm}which is farmed by Mr.J.Johnston. It covers 140 acres and is a mixed dairy/cereal farm. The milk is sold to the Dairy and the cereals are also sold. Some land is used to provide grass for the cattle. There are 2 main{game preserves}in the area. One is in "The Bogs" near Berkswell and the other is in the woods bordering Bickenhill Lane at Hampton-in-Arden.
